column4: I'm trying to install ubuntu via the disc on a old computer with windows 98 on it, Via the disc, But it just hangs and says "boot from ATAI cdrom:"
clear
ops
I'm trying to install ubuntu via the disc on a old computer with windows 98 on it, But it just hangs and says "boot from ATAI cdrom:"
hardware specs ?
New to cocking about with computer hardware, All I can remember is the RAM is 256MB
i think that the livecd needs more ram than that. you maybe have to try with xubuntu via an alternatecd install
alternate is a text mode intall (like the first half of WinXP install)
Ah ok, Just just burn the xubuntu iso to a disc? nothing special?
yes the alternate one
alternate one?
there are two types of CD's the desktop and the alternate
for low memory systems use the alternate cd
riverbird: Getting it now, Thanks Alot :-) 50 minutes to wait for the download though :-(
linux executables can not embed an icon
Damn, Ok thanks
you have to use the correct /dev/sdxx node
How do I find out which one it is (mount) It isn't sda1
when you plug the disk in do « dmesg | tail »
appears to be sda2
Says I need to spefy a filesystem type to mount it
i dounb is in the same disk trhe system is in ? maybe is sdb ?
